results.title: The Sacrifice
results.brief_description: A narrative of courage, family and a life saved. Dragush’s father was dying of kidney failure. His father’s sister, Lina, travelled half way across the world to Australia from Albania, leaving her home and family behind, so that she could help save her brother’s life by donating one of her own kidneys. This story is a dedication to Aunty Lina and the importance of family.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Patience
results.brief_description: A poetic tale of elusive love, of numbness and loss and being shut off from the outside world. Can love be found? An evocative work created through the use of black and white images and an ambient soundtrack.

results.title: The Australian story: overlanders of tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Doc K Sternberg and C G Scrimgeour
results.brief_description: The airlift of stud cattle to Brunette Downs Station in the Northern Territory for a stud stock sale is shown followed by the festivities held after the sale.

results.title: Laughter and hope
results.brief_description: In 1966 at the age of nine Maria Savarino was reunited with her parents who had migrated to Australia from Italy six years earlier. In doing so she also lost a very special person - her Aunt Maria, who had looked after her in those intervening years in Italy. This is Maria’s story about her very special namesake and role model.

results.title: The Australian Opera favourites
results.brief_description: Presented by Peter Ross, this video brings together a popular selection of extracts from some of the world’s best operas. Highlights from the Australian Opera productions of ‘La Boheme’, ‘Il Trovatore’, ‘Tosca’, ‘A Masked ball’, ‘Lakme’, ‘La Traviata’, ‘The Merry widow’.

results.title: The Australian Royal Tours Collection 1901-1988
results.creator_credit: John Mandleberg, Film Australia and Aviva Ziegler
results.brief_description: A unique, visual cavalcade documenting the history of Australian tours by the British Royal Family since the turn of the century. It captures all the pomp and ceremony of the visits in the early 1900s by King George V, Edward the Prince of Wales and George VI, Queen Elizabeth’s first visit in 1954 and continues through to the younger generation of Royals with Diana and Fergie’s recent visits. Rated: G

results.title: La partria o la tumba
results.brief_description: Socialist parents, rebellious children - it runs in the blood. Esteban’s parents originally came from Uruguay but were forced to flee to Australia in 1974 from the ruling military regime. His father, aged 32, and mother, aged 21, eventually settled in Melbourne raising four children and establishing the first South American bakery, in Yarraville. In this story, Esteban talks of his family’s experiences and his deep respect for his wonderful rebellious parents.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: The Australian National University
results.creator_credit: John Morris, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Surveys the teaching and research facilities of the Australian National University. Shows examples of investigations being pursued in microbiology, botany, geophysics, English, law, archaeology, Indonesian, literature, zoology, demography, astronomy, and political science. Photography: Tom Cowan; Music: Moneta Eagles.

results.title: Kylie
results.brief_description: A story about family relationships and two sisters growing up without a father. Separated by distance, emotionally and physically, Scarlett expresses her thoughts and feelings about her older sister Kylie. Change, it seems, is inevitable but change can also inspire.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Populate or perish
results.brief_description: Explores Australia’s population debate showing how after 50 years of continuous growth, new arguments about limiting Australia’s population are emerging. This program examines the post-war era when the cry to “Populate or perish” fostered Government sponsored immigration shemes, provided the applicants were white. It traces the gradual evolution of Australia as a multicultural society, primarily concentrated on the east coast.
